'''Peleg''' was the son of [[Indor (grandfather of Tuor)|Indor]] and the father of [[Tuor]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. Therefore, like Tuor, he probably belonged to the [[House of the Swan]].<ref>{{LT2|III}}, p. 160</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Peleg'' is in [[Gnomish]], meaning "axe",<ref>{{LT2|Appendix}}, entry '''Peleg''', p. 346</ref> and its [[Qenya]] cognate is '''''Pelek'''''.<ref>{{PE|13}}, "[[Official Name List]]", p. 103</ref>

In ''[[The Lay of the Fall of Gondolin]]'', from c. [[1920]], his name was changed to '''''Fengel''''', a name that was later used for the [[Fengel|fifteen King of Rohan]].<ref>{{LB|2c}}, p. 145</ref>
